css.introduction: Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) is a stylesheet language used for describing the presentation of a document written in HTML or XML.

syntax.selectors: Selectors are used to target the HTML elements you want to style. They can be element selectors, class selectors, id selectors, etc.
syntax.properties: CSS properties are used to specify the styles of elements. Each property has a name and a value.
syntax.declaration: A declaration consists of a property and its corresponding value, separated by a colon and terminated by a semicolon.
syntax.rule: A CSS rule consists of a selector and a declaration block, which contains one or more declarations.
syntax.comments: Comments in CSS start with /* and end with */. They are ignored by the browser and are used to add notes or descriptions in the code.

selectors.element: Selects HTML elements by their tag name.
selectors.class: Selects HTML elements with a specific class attribute.
selectors.id: Selects a single HTML element with a specific id attribute.
selectors.attribute: Selects HTML elements with a specific attribute or attribute value.
selectors.pseudo: Selects elements based on their state or position in the document.

properties.color: Specifies the text color of an element.
properties.background-color: Specifies the background color of an element.
properties.font-size: Specifies the size of the font.
properties.font-family: Specifies the font family to be used for text.
properties.margin: Specifies the margin space around an element.
properties.padding: Specifies the padding space around an element.
properties.border: Specifies the border properties of an element.
properties.width: Specifies the width of an element.
properties.height: Specifies the height of an element.

problems.solution: Check if the selector is targeting the correct element. Verify if there are any conflicting styles or specificity issues.
Use responsive design techniques such as media queries to adjust the layout based on the device's screen size. Test the website on multiple devices and browsers.
Ensure that the container has sufficient width and height to accommodate the text. Consider using CSS properties like overflow to handle overflow issues.

examples.code:
.box { animation: spin 2s linear infinite; }
@keyframes spin { 0% { transform: rotate(0deg); } 100% { transform: rotate(360deg); } }

a { color: blue; text-decoration: none; }
a:hover { text-decoration: underline; }
.box { position: absolute; top: 50%; left: 50%; transform: translate(-50%, -50%); }
